entry.title: [RemoveLegacy] Represent VisualOverflow by PhysicalRect, not LayoutRect
entry.content:
Now VisualOverflow boxes are in the physical coordinate system, instead

of the flipped block-flow physical coordinate system. This CL replaces

LayoutRect usages for VisualOverflow with PhysicalRect.



* All LayoutRect usages in BoxVisualOverflowModel are replaced with

PhysicalRect



* VisualOverflowRect(), SelfVisualOverflowRect(), and

ContentsVisualOverflowRect() return PhysicalRect. Their

'Physical' variants are removed.



* VisualOverflowRectForPropagation() is removed. We don't need to flip

VisualOverflow boxes any longer.



This CL should have no behavior changes.



Bug: 1229581

Change-Id: Id231b65cb3f80e3b60715efec164149eb1edec00

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4904260

Auto-Submit: Kent Tamura

Reviewed-by: Koji Ishii

Commit-Queue: Kent Tamura

entry.title: http/tests/xmlhttprequest/send-on-abort.html: increase timeout
entry.content:
http/tests/xmlhttprequest/send-on-abort.html is flaky, probably because

it doesn't wait long enough before aborting.



Increase the timeout from 100ms to 2000ms. The test doesn't have to wait

for the timeout in the success case, so there is no impact on test

throughput.



BUG=1486584

entry.title: Fix GetPendingScaleFactor
entry.content:
This CL fixes the regression issue caused by CL:4744148.



When the double-buffered scale factor is not set by shell,

`SurfaceTreeHost::GetPendingScaleFactor` returns

`host_window_->layer()->device_scale_factor()` as a fallback.

But before the initial commit (i.e., before `host_window()` is added to

the widget), because host_window() is not attached to any root window,

`device_scale_factor()` just returns the default value (1.f).



Therefore, this CL makes `GetPendingScaleFactor` return the scale factor

of the pending target display when the host_window() doesn’t have parent

&& pending_scale_factor_ is not set.



BUG=b:296950585

TEST=ClientControlledShellSurfaceTest.SetBoundsWithoutExplicitScaleFactorSet

TEST=existing unittests pass



Change-Id: I1d892d8223b7493eed969b595b88a8080ddca214

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4899744

Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima

Commit-Queue: Toshiki Kikuchi

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1204465}

comparison to other dispatch metrics that excluded it. After this change

entry.title: [dPWA] Show origin in web app title bar when navigating across origins
entry.content:
When navigating in a web app window between different origins that are

within the app's extended scope (using scope_extensions), the user needs

to be kept aware of their security context. As a CCT UI is no longer

displayed when navigating within extended scope, this CL modifies the

title bar origin text both in terms of what is shown and when it is

shown.



Previous behavior:

- Always show origin of start URL.

- Shows text when the app window launches or when theme color changes.

- Does not show text when a CCT UI is also shown.

- Except when theme color changes.



New behavior (with feature flag enabled):

- Shows origin of current committed web content instead of always

showing origin of the app's start url.

- Shows origin when navigating to a different origin.

- Even when a CCT UI is shown.



Screen capture:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mAOL_iSpuwLRoy48rknTD4tJ77eKIGAo/view?usp=sharing



Explainer:

https://github.com/WICG/manifest-incubations/blob/gh-pages/scope_extensions-explainer.md



Design doc:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-idhx8heajbPYl3cdXFVCjpIuf96cRa_DrRk6147ELI/edit



Bug: 1250011

Change-Id: I6df595eba842e8dc1b9a061114662e08b44296cf

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4602916

Reviewed-by: Alan Cutter

entry.title: Revert "[Files]: Merging search container and search controller."
entry.content:
This reverts commit fc96f5bceab8ed7fb35b3f0ff9c34afaf7a909f3.



Reason for revert: This CL is causing Android CTS to fail (b/302078919)



Original change's description:

> [Files]: Merging search container and search controller.

>

> With Search V1 removed we have a change to merge search container and

> search controller. The latter handles two cases. One: changes in search

> (either query or options) to request the directory model to perform

> a file search. Two: changes in the current directory, to request that

> the current search is terminated. These two functions are now migrated

> to search container.

entry.title: [telemtry] Fix ApiGuardDelegateShimlessRMAAppTest
entry.content:
If we enable IWA, the navigator will launch IWA in a new screen and make

the tests crash, because the test helper method AddTab assume the

contents is in the tab it adds.

To better match the real implementation, the shimless rma tests now

launch the app in Shimless app dialog. Also remove the test cases for

non-IWA because they won't be launched in Shimless app dialog.



Bug: b:297155775

Test: Test with CL:4899697

entry.title: snap-groups: Move StartOverview to SnapGroupController
entry.content:
This moves `StartSplitViewOverviewSession()` from

`SplitViewController::OnWindowSnapped()` to

`SnapGroupController::OnWindowSnapped()`. This will allow us to start

a new overview session on top of multiple snap groups.



Note that we notify `SnapGroupController` from `WindowState` directly

rather than `OnPostWindowStateTypeChange()` because we may need to

support async, i.e. ARC++ windows.

entry.title: [QuickStart]: Fix parsing of BootstrapConfigruations message
entry.content:
This CL cherrypicks @cclem's patchset here https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4898523/1 and fixes broken

unittests.



The original cl description from link above:

There were several issues preventing BootstrapConfigurations from being

parsed correctly:



- Connection::ParseBootstrapConfigurations does not handle the case

where its optional argument is nullopt, leading to a crash if parsing

fails.

- A BootstrapConfigurations message from the phone may contain a

QuickStartPayload containing some extraneous information we don't

care about. This was causing us to misinterpret a

BootstrapConfigurations message as a type of QuickStartPayload.

- The "deviceDetails" key should not be nested under

"bootstrapConfigurations" according to the messaging spec.



Test: manually tested with atlas and pixel4a and updated unittests

entry.title: Default sse4.2 (inclusive) for all of lacros (chromeos) builds
entry.content:
Compiler flags for SIMD feature instructions are not version

cumulative. All SSE version flags must be used to use the instructions

featured in each feature release.



This was slightly unexpected and was discovered during profiling of

the previous cl. [0]



Normal chromeos builds use "-msse3" in the gni args so the previous

change had only the effect of including sse4.2 specific instructions

for compilation of the lacros binary.



We got

https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/docs/intrinsics-guide/index.html#ssetechs=SSE4_2



But we also want

https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/docs/intrinsics-guide/index.html#ssetechs=SSSE3,SSE4_1





The regression here [1] was found because the non chromeos (ie linux)

version of lacros does not build with the chromos gni and therefore

did not have "-msse3".



[0]

https://crrev.com/c/4903488



[1]

https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1488239#c7



[2]

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10686638/whats-the-difference-among-cflgs-sse-options-of-msse-msse2-mssse3-msse4



Bug: 1475858

Change-Id: Iaba432f74edc0aafa2b410d6635ee19dd4c1f10f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4907301

Reviewed-by: Bruce Dawson

Commit-Queue: Peter McNeeley

entry.title: [Promise Icons] Fix crash when ShelfItem poorly created for promise app
entry.content:
Previously, it was possible for a regular ShelfItem to be created for

a promise app. This would happen when a promise app is registered in

the PromiseAppRegistryCache but marked with should_show=false, and

ChromeShelfController::UpdatePinnedAppsFromSync() is called by

something else. This ends up creating a ShelfItem that:

- Isn't explicitly "hidden" in App Service (since IsAppHiddenFromShelf

returns false if the app ID isn't recognised)

- Isn't a promise app



This results in a ShelfItem that shouldn't have been created, which

causes a CHECK crash when we try to create a ShelfItem for the promise

app when it's set to should_show=true because the ShelfIds and index

in the model are mixed up between being a regular ShelfItem and a

promise ShelfItem.



Additionally, simplify code and add a temporary fix for a separate

ShelfViews crash.

entry.title: Fix incorrect cohort registry key
entry.content:
When migrating from O3 to O4 the Chromium Updater imports cohort

information from O3's cohort registry key located at

`{CLIENT_STATE_KEY}\{app_id}\cohort`. However, O4 currently uses

`{CLIENT_STATE_KEY}\cohort\{app_id}` meaning cohort information is lost

on migration.



Fix by updating `GetAppCohortKey` to return

`{CLIENT_STATE_KEY}\{app_id}\cohort`.



Bug: 1488586

entry.title: Move declaration of ts enum MIN_VALUE and MAX_VALUE to the top
entry.content:
Typescript generates reverse mappings for integer based enums as

described here:

https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/enums.html#reverse-mappings



The later definition "wins" in the reverse mapping, therefore

declaring the MIN_VALUE and MAX_VALUE at the end is problematic because

they will override the actual enum keys in the reverse mapping.



This change swaps the declaration ordering of the MIN_VALUE and

MAX_VALUE relative to the actual values. This should ensure that the

actual values should be persisted when typescript generates the revese

mapping.



Fixed: 1476696

Change-Id: I9f1c17d7a2bc61a9897dbbde39f12fd5448d38e8

Implements a Snackbar that is shown when an auto-translation happens

when using the Translate Message UI. The CTA on the Snackbar is to

undo the translation and re-show the Translate Message UI.



The Snackbar UI exists in the WindowAndroid context, unlike the

Message UI which is attached to WebContents. To close the Auto-

Translate Snackbar on page navigation or when the tab changes the

WebContentsObserver implementation on ChromeTranslateClient is used.

entry.content:

is an occasional race. This is a speculative fix for those scenarios.

entry.title: Simplify the creation of indices on the `interest_groups` table.
entry.content:
These indices need to be created regardless of whether the database is

created from scratch by `CreateVxxSchema` or upgraded by the *latest*

`UpgradeVxxSchemaToVxx` functions to have dropped and recreated the

`interest_groups` table. This change removes some of the extraneous

calls to `CreateInterestGroupIndices` from earlier

`UpgradeVxxSchemaToVxx` functions, because those indices would have

been dropped and recreated in subsequent `UpgradeVxxSchemaToVxx`

functions. These later `UpgradeVxxSchemaToVxx` functions are guaranteed

to be called, since any client with an out-of-date schema is upgraded to

the latest available version of the schema. This change also clarifies

when the `CreateInterestGroupIndices` function should be called in its

comment.



Change-Id: I3cc37e652d618b414d63842b1e49277e7a21516f

entry.title: Disallow calling `SetUserData()` when destroying `SupportsUserData`.
entry.content:
Doing this isn't immediately problematic: `~SupportsUserData()` attempts

to work around reentrant calls into itself by swapping out the backing

map during destruction.



However, if code calls `SetUserData()` on the `SupportsUserData` being

destroyed, this means the backing map is no longer empty—and when the

body of the destructor is complete, if the same problematic code calls

`SetUserData()` while `SupportsUserData`'s fields are being destroyed,

bad things will happen, since containers:

- require iterating over the elements during destruction

- are not robust against mutation of the container itself during

iteration



There are no new checks added to `GetUserData()`. While not ideal, it

is not dangerous in the same way that calling `SetUserData()` would be.

`GetUserData()` will always return `nullptr` in this case.



Checks *will* be added to `RemoveUserData()` and `TakeUserData()` in

followups. While they are not actively dangerous in the same way

`SetUserData()` is, it is conceptually incorrect to attempt to mutate

the `SupportsUserData` during destruction. It is also entirely possible

that landing this CL will reveal interesting bugs in the wild, so

landing these checks in separate CLs means that reverts can be limited

in scope.



Bug: 1483288

Change-Id: Ib21626a5ce59480baf231c93630642484b9c3148

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4906190

entry.title: Default enable multiple cloud providers support
entry.content:
This CL default enables the multiple cloud providers support for

Attribution Reporting API. As part of the change, the aggregation

service will use new public key endpoints: origin + .well-known path,

which impacts both Attribution Reporting API and Private Aggregation

API.



Note that multiple cloud providers is not supported in Private

Aggregation yet, which will then use the default AWS origin.



Also note that we plan to disable the feature if the intent to ship

is not approved before the stable release.

entry.title: [Extensions] Avoid starting a worker when it is kStarting.
entry.content:
This removes one case where we start a service worker in response to an

event needing to be dispatched.



Before this change we didn't check the running status of a worker and

instead would start a worker if was starting (kStarting). It's likely

the worker will start soon and we'll run the task via

ServiceWorkerTaskQueue::DidStartServiceWorkerContext() or

ServiceWorkerTaskQueue::DidStartWorkerForScope() though.



This practically means that if multiple tasks built-up while in this

starting status we would try to start the worker. For example: taskA is

dispatched and causes the worker to start. TaskB comes into

ServiceWorkerTaskQueue::AddPendingTask() a moment later when the worker

hasn't finished starting (and is in kStarting) and we would

then redundantly attempt to start the worker.



After this change if the worker has

blink::EmbeddedWorkerStatus::kStarting status when taskB arrives it will

not cause us to redundantly attempt to start the worker when it is

already in the kStarting status.



This new behavior is disabled by default and will be enabled with via a

rollout due to its potential wide impact on MV3/service workers. It is

effectively gates behind the

extensions_features:: kExtensionsServiceWorkerOptimizedEventDispatch

feature check in ServiceWorkerTaskQueue::AddPendingTask().



Bug: 1467015

entry.title: Make absl::optional a typedef for std::optional
entry.content:
This only changes the types around. It doesn't rewrite existing uses

to std::optional, which we can do incrementally.



absl::optional to std::optional seems to have two visible impacts.

First, the field order is different (bool first vs bool last).

std::optional's order (bool last) seems to be better overall, decreasing

binary size. Second, absl::optional's assertions crash with

__builtin_trap, while std::optional calls __libcpp_verbose_abort which

calls base::ImmediateCrash. __builtin_trap permits the compiler to

combine crash sites within a function but leads to worse crash

debugging. In base::ImmediateCrash, we'd made a conscious decision to

prefer debuggability and pay some binary size for it. The net size

increase brings our optional type in line with that preference.



For more details see the discussion and document below:

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/cxx/c/XG3G85_ZF1k/m/_QN8adIJBQAJ

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1AW7q9HCLOk738OCj8Z2U_AKVUC0YIFZWuyRvv09XTHk/edit



Binary-Size: See discussion above.

Fuchsia-Binary-Size: See discussion above.

entry.title: [BITS] Don't give up on transient errors
entry.content:
The BITS CRX downloader will wait up to 15 mins for a transient error to

resolve itself. However, download telemetry shows that the most common

error resulting in aborted transfers stems from BITS pausing

for game mode. Downloads can still be cleaned up by the no-progress

timeout or stale job purge.

entry.title: Keep software compositing state up to date on main thread
entry.content:
ImageBitmapRendering contexts sometime glitch when the browser falls

back to software compositing mode. This is because the state stored

in SharedGpuContext was not kept up to date. This code used to work

properly because falling back to software compositing was always

accompanied by a GPU context loss, which cause SharedGpuContext to

update its state. But this is no longer the case. This CL solves the

problem on the main thread. But there still may be issues on Worker,

though there are no obvious repro steps to trigger the bug on a Worker.



Bug: 1486981

entry.title: Add DNS_TRANSACTION NetLog event source
entry.content:
Before this CL, DnsTransactionImpl used {Begin,End}Event() to record

net log events with a NetLogWithSource instance that is bound to

HostResolverManager::Job. This was confusing because:

* HostResolverManager::Job can issue multiple queries (AAAA/A/HTTPS).

* {Begin,End}Event() assume that these are paired.

* There is no guarantee on the order of responses.

* As a result, DNS_TRANSACTION events could be unintentionally nested

and {Begin,End} events could be mismatched.



This CL fixes the problem by adding a separate net log event source for

DnsTransactionImpl.



Bug: 1281794

entry.title: [remoting] Fix host exit-code handling in the Python script.
entry.content:
When a host is disabled, the host process exits with code 106 instead

of 101. This CL updates the handling of code 106 to match the intended

handling of 101 - the host config is deleted (re-written with empty

JSON content).



The Python script also has some errors which appear to have been

introduced by recent refactoring, possibly

http://crrev.com/b9cdbc162ad4db268e568664f6fd14a617b795d9



Specifically, some code was moved out of main() into a new class

method, which handled the different host exit-codes:



* Instances of "return 0" would previously have exited the script, but

instead they return 0 from a method that returns a boolean "tear_down"

flag. This CL fixes all these cases to actually exit the process.

* The code referred to "host_config" which was a variable in main().

This CL addresses this by adding a new "host_config" member to the

Desktop base-class.



Bug: b/302591603

entry.title: Make Mac sandbox initialization errors available to crash dumps
entry.content:
Store any errors logged during sandbox initialization in a crash

annotation message. These are a similar concept to crash keys and are

supported by both the macOS crash reporter and Crashpad. We use them

here to avoid adding the dependency on //base in the sandbox code that

crash keys would entail.



Fatal errors already store their messages in crash annotations due to

the use of `abort_report_np` in the fatal error code path.



This extra information should help with tracking down the "Failed to

initialize sandbox" crashes we've been seeing a spike in recently in

https://crbug.com/1473983.



Bug: 1473983

entry.title: android: Sync the date on emulator during AVD start.
entry.content:
The date on emulator was out of date due to:

1. The emulator loaded from a snapshot, and the date is set during the

snapshot creation.

2. The network is intentionally disabled on emulator so as a side-effect

it won't be able to sync the time through network.



Some tests require the device date to be up-to-date.

So force syncing the date during emulator launch.



A follow-up is to move this feature to devil library.

entry.title: Paint background invalidation when deleting the last element of TableRow
entry.content:
When the last element in a TableRow is deleted, it does not trigger

a redraw of the background,causing the background to persist.

After removing the last element of a row in a Table,

the size of the TableRow remains unchanged because it does not affect

the layout of the preceding elements.

Therefore, caching is used during rendering.

We should proactively trigger a redraw of this row when deleting

the last element of a table row.



Bug: 1487554

Change-Id: Ia45f5abf8ccd54781e8f0c1de04aebfa5cad552c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4900123

Reviewed-by: Rune Lillesveen

Reviewed-by: Xianzhu Wang

Commit-Queue: Xianzhu Wang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1204290}

entry.title: Turn on use_dummy_lastchange for all builders on the CQ.
entry.content:
Using the dummy lastchange should prevent needing to recompile object

files that incorporate the lastchange file when CLs otherwise wouldn't

affect those outputs. This should reduce the number of compile actions

on the RBE backend, which is currently hitting its limits.



All builders that are on the CQ and perform compiles have been updated,

as well as any configs containing the word trybot.



Change-Id: I696707264d4dc6044976bdbea4959fdf23b4cd52

No-Try: true

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4908233

Auto-Submit: Garrett Beaty

Reviewed-by: Struan Shrimpton

Commit-Queue: Garrett Beaty

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1204289}

entry.title: snap-group: Divider stacking order with transient windows
entry.content:
This cl fixed the issue that the stacking order of the divider

may still be on top of the newly added transient window. We want

to make divider a transient child of the top window whose lifetime

will not be controlled by its transient parent i.e. the top window.

This is achieved by `parent_controls_lifetime_` indicator in

`TransientWindowManager` to make it possible for transient children

to outlive their transient parents if the value is false.



Fixed: b/297448600

Demo: http://b/297448600#comment3

Test: Added unit tests + manual

Change-Id: If20b70b956df6b6d2897ce8460328d06a14604da

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4848887

Reviewed-by: Scott Violet

Commit-Queue: Michele Fan
